EmailTemplate.name: 201904_TechTips_CPCVideo_lg.201904_TechTips_CPCVideo_Mail
EmailTemplate.subject: Easily Troubleshoot your Cabin Pressure Controller
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
<[[https://aerospace.honeywell.com/]]> TECH TIPS | CABIN PRESSURE CONTROLLER TROUBLESHOOTING Dear Customer, Have you experienced a cabin pressure controller (CPC) issue on your Boeing 757 or 767? Boeing and Honeywell have released a helpful video <https://youtu.be/lzxcW5FuQUc> and supporting documentation to help you troubleshoot your CPC system. Engine indicating and crew alerting system messages do not always contain sufficient information to diagnose a CPC system from the flight deck. As a result, we have observed an abnormally high no-fault-found rate on the CPCs returned to our service centers for repair, causing unnecessary cost to the owner, operator and customer. This trend indicates that additional in-depth on-wing troubleshooting is necessary to keep the CPCs installed on the aircraft while determining the correct root cause. Our video <[[https://youtu.be/lzxcW5FuQUc]]> helps demonstrate these best practices for on-wing CPC troubleshooting. Please also refer to the MyBoeingFleet website <[[https://www.myboeingfleet.com/ReverseProxy/Authentication.html]]> for the latest aircraft maintenance manual and the fault isolation manual for the 757 and 767 aircraft. The "757 and 767 Cabin Pressure Controller Troubleshooting" video can be found under the Supplemental Videos section. Need other technical support? Visit our MyAerospace Technical Knowledge Center <[[https://myaerospace.honeywell.com/services-and-support/support/technical-support]]> for troubleshooting articles, technical publications, or to submit questions to our technical support engineering team.
VISIT MYAEROSPACE <http://www.myaerospace.honeywell.com>
